intro: Mappa leptostachya, commonly known as the slender-stemmed mappa, is a herbaceous plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, arranged in clusters, and it produces small, smooth fruits. Mappa leptostachya is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories.
